channel.title: Books on Mark Jago
channel.description: Recent content in Books on Mark Jago

item.title: Impossible Worlds
item.description: We need to understand the impossible. Francesco Berto and Mark Jago start by considering what the concepts of meaning, information, knowledge, belief, fiction, conditionality, and counterfactual supposition have in common.

item.title: Reality Making
item.description: What makes up reality, and how? What kinds of entity are fundamental to reality, and how do dependent entities depend on the fundamental ones?

item.title: The Impossible
item.description: I present an original philosophical account of meaningful thought: in particular, how it is meaningful to think about things that are impossible.

item.title: What Truth Is
item.description: I present and defend a novel theory of what truth is, in terms of the metaphysical notion of truthmaking. This is the relation which holds between a truth and some entity in the world, in virtue of which that truth is true.
